result.execSummary:
The defendant Artez K Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

No drugs or alcohol.

No firearms; weapons.
Parties may not reside in victim's home without consent of agent.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling and continue programing.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Restitution set at zero.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfullycomplete recommended treatment.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Artez K Wilson in court with Attorney Jeff Carpenter.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent Jodi Smith also in court.
Defendant needs to finish BIP counseling.  Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.   mld

Defendant Artez K Wilson in court.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent Jodi Smith also in court.
The Court ordered another review hearing to further monitor the defendant.  The Court ordered the stay on the condition time to continue until the next court date.  
Case adjourned to 12-12-2014 at 1:30 p.m. for probation review hearing in Branch 4.   mld

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #2 and #3, dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements of the Offense/Jury instruction received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint.  Judgment of conviction entered.   Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No violent contact with victim, Krystol H.  
   Parties may not reside in victim's home without consent of agent.  
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge, and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 8-29-2014 AT 1:30 PM.
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit (not filed by defense counsel);
Filed, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  mld

Defendant Artez K Wilson in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 "On states motion, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #1 to Battery (Domestic Abuse), Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 940.19(1) and 968.075(1)(a) a Class A Misdemeanor."   This now makes this charge a misdemeanor.  mld

Defendant Artez K Wilson in court with attorney Richard J. Carpenter.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Off the record, due to the unavailability of the court and the request of defense counsel, Plea and Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to Branch 4 on 5-22-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Artez K Wilson in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  3rd party contact to see children would be allowed per the Court.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-1-2014 at 1:30 pm.  All conditions of bail including the no contact order are continued until further order of the Court.   mld
Court ordered defendant to have no contact with Krystol H., or the address of 5350 N. 56th Street, Milwaukee, WI.   mld

Defendant Artez K Wilson in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty as to count #3.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 2-20-2014 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail, including the no contact order are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Artez K Wilson in court with attorney Richard J Carpenter.  Defendant Artez K Wilson in custody.  Nicholas S Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  As to MISDEMEANOR Counts 1 and 2, defense enters plea of NOT GUILTY.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
